chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa R. Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.  

May apply for early discharge from probation after 18 months, if defendant is in full compliance with probation.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and stayed on the condition defendant successfully complete AODA, and any other treatment and counseling probation agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Rescheduled AIA for afternoon at request of atty Osborne as he will be here in Jackson at that time.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Per phone call from atty Osborne-was just retained and not available on 6/9. Rescheduled to the following week and Atty Osborne will submit a notice of retainer.
Acknowledgement of rights at initial appearance form.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Randy M.  REPORT FOR BOOKING
